patientDetail.generalAnesthesiaDescription: Complete loss of consciousness using intravenous and/or inhaled medications.
patientDetail.generalAnesthesiaRisks: Nausea, vomiting, sore throat, dental damage, awareness during anesthesia (rare), allergic reactions, cardiovascular complications.
patientDetail.analgosedationDescription: Light sedation for minor surgical procedures, typically combined with local anesthetic administered by the surgeon. Anesthesia stand-by for patient monitoring and safety.
patientDetail.analgosedationRisks: Allergic reactions, respiratory depression, need to escalate to general anesthesia, nausea, paradoxical reactions.
patientDetail.regionalAnesthesiaDescription: Numbing of a specific region using local anesthetic injections (spinal, epidural, nerve blocks).
patientDetail.regionalAnesthesiaRisks: Headache, back pain, nerve damage (rare), hypotension, bleeding, infection at injection site.
patientDetail.plannedInstallationsDescription: Placement of intravenous lines, arterial lines, central lines, or urinary catheters as needed.
patientDetail.plannedInstallationsRisks: Infection, bleeding, hematoma, pneumothorax (for central lines), thrombosis.
patientDetail.postoperativeIcuDescription: Transfer to Intensive Care Unit for close monitoring after surgery.
patientDetail.postoperativeIcuPurpose: Purpose: Close hemodynamic monitoring, respiratory support, pain management, and early detection of complications.

alerts.title: Alerts & Insights
alerts.highCancellationDesc: Cancellation rate of 4.8% exceeds the 3% target. Consider reviewing scheduling processes.
alerts.or3OverloadDesc: Room utilization at 91% may cause scheduling stress. Consider redistributing cases.
alerts.turnoverImprovedDesc: Average turnover reduced by 8.5% this month - good progress toward efficiency goals.

surgeryPlanning.title: Surgery Planning
surgeryPlanning.description: Track billing, contracts, and implant status for upcoming surgeries
surgeryPlanning.help: Comprehensive overview of all surgeries with billing, contract, and implant tracking. Click on editable fields to update dates and status.

help.totalSurgeries: The total number of completed surgical procedures. Use this to track surgical volume and capacity planning. Higher numbers indicate more activity, but check quality metrics alongside.
help.totalCosts: Total spending on materials, supplies, and medications used during surgeries. This excludes staff costs. Track this to identify spending trends and potential savings opportunities.
help.avgDuration: Average time from surgery start to end. Shorter durations often mean more efficiency, but too short may indicate incomplete procedures. Compare against similar surgery types for meaningful insights.
help.orUtilization: Percentage of time operating rooms are actively used. Industry benchmark is 70-85%. Below 70% suggests capacity for more surgeries; above 85% may cause scheduling stress and delays.
help.costPerSurgery: Average material and supply cost per surgical procedure. Use this to identify cost optimization opportunities. Compare across surgery types and time periods to spot anomalies.
help.turnoverTime: Time between one surgery ending and the next beginning in the same room. Includes cleaning, preparation, and patient transfer. Shorter times mean more efficient room use.
help.onTimeStart: Percentage of surgeries that started within 15 minutes of scheduled time. High rates indicate good scheduling and preparation. Low rates may signal process issues.
help.cancellationRate: Percentage of planned surgeries that were cancelled. High rates waste resources and delay patient care. Target is typically below 5%.
help.surgeryTrend: Shows how surgical volume changes over time compared to planned targets. Gaps between actual and planned indicate scheduling accuracy and capacity issues.
help.costTrend: Tracks monthly spending against budget. Consistent overruns may indicate pricing issues or usage inefficiencies. Use this for financial planning and forecasting.
help.surgeryByType: Distribution of surgical procedures by category. Use this to understand your case mix and plan resources accordingly. Changes in mix affect staffing and supply needs.
help.roomUtilization: How efficiently each operating room is being used. Uneven distribution may indicate scheduling opportunities. Rooms consistently below target may need process review.
help.alerts: Automated insights highlighting areas needing attention. Green alerts show positive trends, amber indicates caution, red requires immediate action.
help.staffCosts: Total cost of hourly/rented staff working during surgeries. Includes surgeons, nurses, anesthesiologists, and assistants. Track this to manage labor expenses.
help.staffCostTrend: Shows how staff labor costs change over time compared to budget. Useful for identifying staffing efficiency and planning future budgets.
help.staffCostByRole: Distribution of staff costs by role (surgeons, nurses, anesthesiologists, etc.). Helps understand where labor costs are concentrated.
help.staffCostBreakdown: Detailed breakdown of costs per staff member, including hourly rates, hours worked, and total costs. Use this to identify high-cost personnel and optimize scheduling.
help.avgCostPerSurgeryInclLabor: Average total cost per surgery including both materials and staff labor. This gives a complete picture of per-procedure expenses.
help.totalStaffCost: Total spending on hourly/rented staff this period. Includes all roles - surgeons, anesthesiologists, nurses, and assistants. Track trends to manage labor budget.
help.totalHours: Total hours worked by all staff members during surgeries. Compare with surgery count to understand staffing efficiency.
help.activeStaff: Number of staff members currently active. Active staff can be assigned to surgeries. Inactive staff are archived but keep historical data.
help.appUsers: Staff members linked to app accounts. These users can log in and access the system. Non-app users are tracked for cost purposes only.
help.internalStaff: Employees who work directly for the clinic. Their costs are typically fixed salaries rather than hourly rates.
help.externalStaff: Rented or temporary staff from agencies. Their costs are tracked hourly for accurate billing and budget planning.
help.totalStaff: Total number of staff members assigned to this hospital across all units and roles.
help.manageStaff: Add, edit, or remove staff members. Set hourly rates, link to app accounts, and track their surgery participation and costs.
help.costByRole: Pie chart showing how labor costs are distributed across different roles. Surgeons typically have highest rates, while assistants have lower rates but more hours.
help.staffCostTrend: Stacked bar chart showing monthly labor costs by role. Use this to spot trends and plan budgets. Rising costs may indicate rate increases or more complex cases.
help.avgCostBySurgeryType: Average staff cost per surgery type. Some procedures require more specialists or longer times. Use this to set accurate procedure pricing.
help.staffCostPerSurgery: Detailed breakdown of labor costs for each individual surgery. Helps identify unusually expensive cases and understand cost drivers.

time.turnoverTrendDesc: Time between surgeries with target line
time.phaseBreakdownDesc: Average time spent in each phase of the surgical process

clinical.accessDeniedDescription: This dashboard is only available for doctors and managers in the anesthesia department.

dashboard.title: Clinical Statistics
dashboard.subtitle: Quality indicators and patient outcome metrics for anesthesia care

charts.ponvTrendDesc: Postoperative nausea and vomiting incidence over time
charts.painScoreTrendDesc: Average pain scores at PACU discharge
charts.normothermiaTrendDesc: Percentage of patients with normal temperature at OR exit
charts.asaDistributionDesc: Patient risk distribution by ASA score
charts.regionalAnesthesiaRateDesc: Trend in nerve block and neuraxial technique usage

alerts.title: Clinical Insights
alerts.description: Key observations and quality improvement opportunities
alerts.ponvImprovedDesc: PONV rate decreased by 8.5% this month, now below the 25% target threshold.
alerts.regionalIncreasedDesc: 48% of eligible cases received regional anesthesia, a 6.7% increase from last month.
alerts.delayedDischargeUpDesc: 3.2% of patients had PACU stays >2x expected. Consider reviewing high-risk case protocols.
alerts.painManagementDesc: Average pain scores at discharge decreased to 2.8, meeting the target of <3.0.

help.ponvRate: Percentage of patients experiencing postoperative nausea and vomiting within 24 hours. Target: <25%
help.avgPainScore: Average Visual Analog Scale (VAS) pain score at PACU discharge. Range 0-10, target: <3
help.normothermia: Percentage of patients with temperature ‚â•36¬∞C at OR exit. Important for reducing complications.
help.avgPacuDuration: Average time spent in Post-Anesthesia Care Unit before discharge or transfer.
help.aldreteTime: Average time to achieve Aldrete score ‚â•9, indicating readiness for discharge.
help.regionalRate: Percentage of eligible cases receiving regional anesthesia (nerve blocks, neuraxial). Higher rates often indicate better multimodal analgesia.
help.unplannedIcu: Percentage of patients unexpectedly transferred to ICU from PACU. Lower is better.
help.whoCompliance: Completion rate of all WHO Surgical Safety Checklist phases (Sign-In, Time-Out, Sign-Out).
help.delayedDischarge: Percentage of patients whose PACU stay exceeded 2x the expected duration.
help.ponvTrendChart: Shows monthly PONV incidence rate with target threshold. Downward trend indicates improvement.
help.painScoreChart: Tracks average pain scores at PACU discharge. Lower scores indicate better pain management.
help.pacuDurationChart: Monthly trend in average PACU stay duration. Shorter stays indicate efficient recovery.
help.normothermiaChart: Temperature compliance rate over time. Higher percentages reduce surgical site infections.
help.techniquesChart: Distribution of anesthesia techniques used across all cases.
help.asaChart: Patient risk classification distribution. Helps identify case complexity trends.
help.complicationsChart: Frequency of perioperative complications by type. Helps identify areas for improvement.
help.regionalRateChart: Trend in regional anesthesia utilization for eligible cases.
help.alerts: Automated insights based on clinical metrics. Highlights improvements and areas needing attention.
